thread.title: That Controversial Comedy Featuring Joseph Fiennes As Michael Jackson Has Been Pulled
thread.title_full: That Controversial Comedy Featuring Joseph Fiennes As Michael Jackson Has Been Pulled

author: Ikran Dahir
title: That Controversial Comedy Featuring Joseph Fiennes As Michael Jackson Has Been Pulled
text:
The show was about an alleged car ride that, according to Vanity Fair , Jackson, Elizabeth Taylor, and Marlon Brando took from New York to Ohio in an attempt to get home after 9/11. ID: 10318829 3. Last week , the trailer for the episode was revealed and people were angry at what they saw. I hope it loses every single dime of its budget. Every single dime. #UrbanMyths https://t.co/99qCA2lkzn
— Keith Powell (@KeithPowell) ID: 10318431 4. They called for a boycott. Boycott culturally insensitive #UrbanMyths & contact @SkyArts Director @PEdgarJones (philip.edgar-jones@sky.uk). J.… https://t.co/3nRqUIqVgH
— The MJCast (@TheMJCast) ID: 10318428 5. A petition against the film gathered over 20,000 supporters. View this image ›
thepetitionsite.com ID: 10318445 6. Paris Jackson, Michael Jackson’s daughter, was asked about the episode and said she was offended by it. View this image ›
Twitter: @ParisJackson ID: 10318353 7. In a statement a Sky spokesperson said that the episode was pulled following concerns expressed by Jackson’s immediate family. “We have taken the decision not to broadcast ‘Elizabeth, Michael and Marlon,’ a half-hour episode from the Sky Arts Urban Myths series, in light of the concerns expressed by Michael Jackson’s immediate family. We set out to take a light-hearted look at reportedly true events and never intended to cause any offence. Joseph Fiennes fully supports our decision.”
ID: 10318327 Check out more articles on BuzzFeed.com!
